messages.message: Just received the aihub update on my personal email. Can we consider adding ib header / logo to those emails in the future on the top of the email.
this is also the message i receive when i click “learn more” — do others have the same?
Same with me ^
maybe someone on the marketing team knows how the email was sent? @aristo
+1 to adding a logo as well, would make this email look more professional/official.
The ones getting the ssl error are you on mobile or on zscaler? Wondering if we are doing a ssl intercept on Instabase.com (http://Instabase.com) domains. @Dave
confirming that the ssl error is from zscaler. works on mobile!
@Ashish guessing some of this applies to our larger SSL strategy?
And cheers to everyone applying all that phishing training to what we send out, awesome to see us being such good citizens
I have the same on my phone
not sure if it's zscaler or chrome
for anyone saying it works on mobile, are you on an iphone with safari?
iphone with chrome and safari for me
@Clemens I presume you aren’t running zscaler on your phone?
on my phone? :smile: no
Cool, that would have been a curveball

So to your point this is less a ZScaler issue and more a cert setup situation (I won’t say issue as I believe we’ve made distinct choices here and depending how we linked it in the email this could all be by design, that said I’ll let the teams that manage that speak to it as I am out of my depth)
@Varun Jain may have context on how this was sent? cc @nikita @Bas @Saurabh
It would be fast, but I believe we just setup SendGrid for this function, if that’s the case Varun is your go to for it
Works on my android, does not work on laptop in Chrome with Zscaler turned off.
Does not work on safari on iPhone

Based on a gmail search on my personal email for sendgrid, all of the urls i see they use in the marketing point to blahhh.sendgrid.net (http://blahhh.sendgrid.net)(com) with the same UPN associated then it redirects

Everyone - Thanks for your inputs! I’ll investigate why we’re seeing this inconsistent UX across devices / browsers, and we’ll incorporate learnings to improve this going forward.

FYI - Out of 6.3K emails delivered, we got 1,039 unique opens so far, for an open rate of ~16.3%.
• Even if all internal users (~300) opened it, at least 700+ external users engaged. 
• 50 users clicked on at least 1 link. Based on the thread, it seems most of the link engagement was internal :sweat_smile:
@Clemens @Dave @nikita
